title: Russia says over 12,000 people left Syria's Ghouta on Thursday
text: March 16, 2018 / 7:07 AM / in 23 minutes Russia says over 12,000 people left Syria's Ghouta on Thursday   ASTANA (Reuters) - Russian Foreign Minister Sergei Lavrov said on Friday that more than 12,000 people left Syriaâ€™s rebel-held eastern Ghouta on Thursday. People walk with their belongings as they flee the rebel-held town of Hammouriyeh, in the village of Beit Sawa, eastern Ghouta, Syria March 15, 2018. REUTERS/Omar Sanadiki He also said that any threat from the United States to strike the Syrian capital Damascus would be unacceptable. Reporting by Olzhas Auyezov and Raushan Nurshayeva; Witing by Maria Tsvetkova; Editing by Christian Lowe
